recipes.name: Chicken and Rice Casserole
recipes.author: Merrily Seely
ingredients: 2 cans of cream of chicken soup
recipes.procedure: Place rice in large pot.  Add 4 c. water & 1 tsp. salt.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat to low.  Cook for 20 minutes.  Sauté onion in butter.  Cube chicken or turkey.  Mix all ingredients together, adding milk last as needed to moisten.  Place in a greased 9” X 13” casserole dish.  Top with: 8 c. crushed Rice Chex cereal  and ½ c. melted butter. Bake at 350° F for 1 hour uncovered.

recipes.name: Chicken Divan
recipes.author: Ruth Johnson
ingredients: 2 10½ oz cans cream of chicken soup
¾ c mayonnaise or salad dressing
recipes.procedure: Cook broccoli until tender, drain.  Arrange in greased 12x7½x2-inch glass baking dish.  Layer chicken atop.  Combine next 3 ingredients and pour over chicken.  Sprinkle with cheese.  Combine crumbs and butter.  Sprinkle over all.  Bake at 350° F about 35 minutes or until heated through.

recipes.name: Chicken Enchiladas
recipes.author: Merrily Seely
ingredients: mozzarella cheese (as much as is desired)
recipes.procedure: Cook and shred 2 c chicken.  Mix 1 can cream of cream of chicken soup and 1 c sour cream.  Coat 6 flour tortillas with soup mixture.  Divide chicken between flour tortillas, adding mozzarella cheese.  Roll and place in 9”x13” pan.  Drizzle remaining sauce over top.  Top with mozzarella cheese.  Cook 30 minutes at 350° F.

recipes.name: Lemon Chicken
recipes.author: Merrily Seely
recipes.procedure:
4 skinless breasts or 8 thighs or any equivalent amount of chicken.  Place chicken in crock pot.  Cover with sauce:
½ c sugar	 ¼ c brown sugar
¾ c lemon juice	 ⅜ c catsup
2 TBSP vinegar
Cover & cook in crock pot 3-4 hours on high or 6-8 hours on low heat.  Blend:
¼ c cold water	¼ c  cornstarch
Mix with cooked liquid in saucepan until thick and bubbly.  Serve with chicken over rice.

recipes.name: Lemon Chicken Skillet Dinner
recipes.author: Our Best Bites
ingredients: ½ tsp ground black pepper, divided
recipes.procedure:
Preheat oven to 450° F.  Place potatoes in a medium saucepan; cover with water. Bring to a boil, and simmer 12 minutes or until tender. Drain.  Line a baking sheet with foil and set aside.  Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 tsp oil to pan. Sprinkle chicken lightly with salt and pepper. Add chicken to pan; cook 5 minutes or until chicken is browned. Turn chicken over and cook for 1 minute.  Transfer chicken to foil-lined pan and place in oven for 10 minutes or until chicken is done.  While chicken is cooking, add remaining 2 tsp oil to skillet. Add potatoes, cut sides down to one side of the skillet, and the mushrooms and garlic to the other. Cook for 3-5 minutes or until browned, stirring mushrooms and garlic.  Remove vegetables from pan and set on a plate to the side.
	Combine milk and flour in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk.  Add flour mixture and 3/4 cup of the chicken broth along with a sprinkle of salt and pepper to the skillet and whisk until smooth.  Bring sauce to a simmer, and add beans.  Simmer 2-3 minutes or until sauce starts to thicken. Add lemon slices, potatoes and mushrooms, and chicken.  If sauce is too thick, add small amounts of chicken broth to thin.  Reduce heat and simmer 3-4 minutes or until beans are crisp-tender. Season with additional salt and pepper to taste.
